tit.e: Toshikoshi-soba (Buckwheat Noodles Eaten on New Year's Eve)
Toshikoshi-soba (Buckwheat Noodles Eaten on New Year's Eve)
tit.cmt: タイトルなので括弧説明を削除しました。下の行に説明括弧を補足しました。

sen.j: 年越し蕎麦（としこしそば）とは、大晦日（12月31日）に縁起をかついで食べられる蕎麦のことである。
sen.e: "Toshikoshi-soba" means buckwheat noodles eaten on New Year's Eve (December 31 of the last year) for good luck.
"Toshikoshi-soba" is a term for buckwheat noodles which are eaten on New Year's Eve (December 31st) for good luck.
sen.cmt: Changed "means" to "is a term for", inserted "which are", removed "of the last year", added "st" to "31".
sen.e: Toshikoshi-soba (Buckwheat Noodles Eaten on New Year's Eve) is a term for buckwheat noodles which are eaten on New Year's Eve (December 31st) for good luck.
sen.cmt: 説明括弧を補足しました。原文に合せて" "を削除しました。

sen.j: 現在の日本では、全国的に見られる風習である。
sen.e: Currently, this custom is observed everywhere in Japan.
Currently, this custom is observed throughout Japan.
sen.cmt: Changed "everywhere" to "throughout".
sen.e: Currently, this custom is observed throughout Japan.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 年を越す前に食べきらなければならず、蕎麦を残すと翌年金運に恵まれないなどと言われている。
sen.e: It is said that people must eat all of the soba (buckwheat noodles) offered since otherwise they would be unlucky with money in the coming year.
It is said that people must eat all of the soba (buckwheat noodles) they are offered before the new year dawns, or else they will be unlucky with money in the coming year.
sen.cmt: Added "before the new year dawns" and "they are", changed "since otherwise" to ", or else", changed "would" to "will".
sen.e: It is said that people must eat all of the soba (buckwheat noodles) they are offered before the new year dawns, or else they will be unlucky with money in the coming year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 元々、江戸時代中期には月末に蕎麦を食べる「三十日（みそか）そば」という習慣があり、大晦日のみにその習慣が残ったものと考えられている。
sen.e: Originally in the middle of the Edo Period, people had a habit of eating "misoka-soba" (literally, buckwheat noodles for the thirtieth day every month) at the end of each month, which habit is believed to have survived only for the last day every year.

Originally, around the middle of the Edo Period, people habitually ate "misoka-soba" (literally, "buckwheat noodles for the thirtieth day of the month") at the end of each month, and the New Year's Eve soba is believed to be the last surviving remnant of this custom.
sen.cmt: Changed "in the" to "around the", changed "had a habit of eating" to "habitually ate", changed "every" to "of the", changed "which habit is believed to have survived only for the last day every year" to "and the New Year's Eve soba is believed to be the last surviving remnant of this custom".
sen.e: Originally, around the middle of the Edo period, people habitually ate 'misoka-soba' (literally, "buckwheat noodles for the thirtieth day of the month") at the end of each month, and the New Year's Eve soba is believed to be the last surviving remnant of this custom.
sen.cmt: period小文字にしました。原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 年越し蕎麦の由来とされる説は「細く長く達者に暮らせることを願う」というものがもっとも一般的である。
sen.e: Toshikoshi-soba is most commonly believed to have originated in the hope for "a thin but long healthy life" like buckwheat noodles.
The most commonly held explanation for the origin of Toshikoshi-soba is the wish for a "slim but long and healthy life", like buckwheat noodles.
sen.cmt: Rewrote.
sen.e: The most commonly held explanation for the origin of Toshikoshi-soba is the wish for a 'slim but long and healthy life,' like buckwheat noodles.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。コンマの位置を訂正しました。

sen.j: 他に「蕎麦が切れやすいことから、一年間の苦労を切り捨て翌年に持ち越さないよう願った」という説もあるが、後付けの説とも言われている。
sen.e: Also believed is a theory that soba noodles are cut easily enough to express the hope for cutting off all burdens imposed during the last year and not to carry them over to the next year, which theory is, however, considered as hindsight in a way.

Another theory is that, since soba noodles are easily cut, they express the hope that all burdens imposed during the last year will be "cut off" and not carried over into the next year; however, this explanation is believed to be newer than the custom.
sen.cmt: Rewrote.
sen.e: Another theory is that, since soba noodles are easily cut, they express the hope that all burdens imposed during the last year will be "cut off" and not carried over into the next year; however, this explanation is believed to be newer than the custom.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 福島県の会津では、大晦日でなく元旦に蕎麦を食べる風習がある（蕎麦以外にも「二日にもち、三日とろろ」といった風習がある）。
sen.e: In Aizu district in Fukushima Prefecture, people are accustomed to eat soba noodles on the New Year's day, not on the eve, besides which they eat "mochi (sticky rice cakes) on the second day and tororo (grated yams) on the third day of the New Year.

In the Aizu district of Fukushima Prefecture, soba noodles are customarily eaten on New Year's Day instead of New Year's Eve; in addition, "mochi" (sticky rice cake) is eaten on the second day and "tororo" (grated yam) is eaten on the third day of the New Year.
sen.cmt: Added "the", changed "in" to "of", changed "people are accustomed to eat soba noodles" to "soba noodles are customarily eaten", removed "the", changed ", not on the eve" to "instead of New Year's Eve", changed ", besides which they eat" to "; in addition,", changed "cakes and yams" to singular, added quote marks around "tororo".
sen.e: In the Aizu district of Fukushima Prefecture, soba noodles are customarily eaten on New Year's Day instead of New Year's Eve; in addition, "mochi" (sticky rice cake) is eaten on the second day and "tororo" (grated yam) is eaten on the third day of the New Year.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 新潟県では、大晦日でなく1月14日（小正月の前日）に蕎麦を食べる「十四日（じゅうよっか）そば」や1月1日（元旦）に蕎麦を食べる風習もある。
sen.e: In Niigata Prefecture, people have a custom to eat soba noodles on the fourteenth day of January (the eve of the Lunar New Year's day) which is called "juu-yokka soba" (literally, "soba noodles for the fourteenth day) and also on the first day of January (the New Year's day) in stead of New Year's Eve.

In Niigata Prefecture, soba noodles are customarily eaten on the fourteenth day of January (the eve of the lunar New Year), when they are called "Juu-yokka soba" (literally, "soba noodles for the fourteenth day), as well as on the first day of January (New Year's Day) instead of New Year's Eve.
sen.cmt: Changed "people have a custom to eat" to "soba noodles are customarily eaten", removed "'s day", removed capital from "lunar", changed "which is" to "when they are", capitalized "Juu-yokka" in keeping with the capitalization of "Toshikoshi", changed "and also" to ", as well as", removed "the", capitalized "Day", changed "in stead" to one word.
sen.e: In Niigata Prefecture, soba noodles are customarily eaten on the fourteenth day of January (the eve of the lunar New Year), when they are called 'Juu-yokka soba' (literally, "soba noodles for the fourteenth day), as well as on the first day of January (New Year's Day) instead of New Year's Eve.
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: また、新潟市北区 (新潟市)（旧・豊栄市）では、大晦日の2400に蕎麦を食するのが一般的である。
sen.e: In Kita Ward, Niigata City (former Toyosaka City,) it is commonly practiced to eat soba noodles at 2400 hour on the New Year Eve.
In the Kita Ward of Niigata City (formerly Toyosaka City,) it is common to eat soba noodles at midnight on New Year's Eve.
sen.cmt: Added "the", changed comma to "of", changed "former" to "formerly", changed "commonly practiced" to "common", changed "2400 hour" to "midnight", removed "the", changed "Year" to "Year's".
sen.e: In the Kita Ward of Niigata City (formerly Toyosaka City,) it is common to eat soba noodles at midnight on New Year's Eve.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 福井県では 濃い目のつゆを大根おろしでのばしてそばにかけ、ネギと鰹節をのせた「おろしそば」（越前そば）を食べることが多い。
sen.e: In Fukui Prefecture, many people eat "oroshi-soba" (literally, "soba noodles with grated daikon radish") (also known as "Echizen soba" or "soba noodles of Echizen province") which is made by pouring onto soba noodles some strong-tasting soup being diluted by adding grated daikon radish and also by adding some green onions and katsuobushi (small pieces of sliced dried bonito.)

In Fukui Prefecture, many people eat "oroshi-soba" (soba noodles with grated daikon radish, also known as "Echizen soba" or "soba noodles of Echizen province") which is made by pouring a strong broth diluted with grated daikon radish over soba noodles and adding green onions and katsuobushi (small shavings of dried bonito).
sen.cmt: Rewrote.
sen.e: In Fukui Prefecture, many people eat 'oroshi-soba' (soba noodles with grated daikon radish, also known as "Echizen soba" or "soba noodles of Echizen province") which is made by pouring a strong broth diluted with grated daikon radish over soba noodles and adding green onions and katsuobushi (small shavings of dried bonito).
sen.cmt: 原文の「」に合せて"を'に訂正しました。

sen.j: 沖縄県では、以前は年越し蕎麦を食べる習慣はなかったが、近年は食べる人も多くなっている（ただし、日本そばではなく沖縄そばを食べる人の割合が多い）。
sen.e: In Okinawa Prefecture, people had previously no habit of eating soba noodles on the New Year's Eve, but recently many became accustomed to eat soba noodles in the same way though they eat Okinawa's soba noodles instead of ordinary soba noodles called Nihon-soba (literally, Japanese buckwheat noodles.)

There was formerly no custom of eating soba noodles on New Year's Eve in Okinawa Prefecture; however, many people have recently begun to eat soba noodles in this way, although many of them eat Okinawan soba noodles instead of "Nihon-soba"noodles (literally, Japanese buckwheat noodles).
sen.cmt: Rewrote.
sen.e: There was formerly no custom of eating soba noodles on New Year's Eve in Okinawa Prefecture; however, many people have recently begun to eat soba noodles in this way, although many of them eat Okinawan soba noodles instead of "Nihon-soba"noodles (literally, Japanese buckwheat noodles).
sen.cmt: 不要なスペースを削除しました。

sen.j: そのほか、サケやイワシなどを食べる地域もある。
sen.e: In some other localities, people eat salmon fillets, sardines and the like on the New Year's Eve.
Additionally, in some regions, people eat salmon fillets, sardines and similar things on New Year's Eve.
sen.cmt: Added "additionally", changed "other localities" to "regions", changed "and the like" to "and similar things", removed "the".
sen.e: Additionally, in some regions, people eat salmon fillets, sardines and similar things on New Year's Eve.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一方で、年越し蕎麦の風習が薄い地域もある。
sen.e: On the other hand, in some parts of Japan, the custom of eating soba noodles on the New Year's Eve is less popular.
There are also regions in Japan where the custom of eating soba noodles on New Year's Eve is less popular.
sen.cmt: Changed "On the other hand, in some parts of Japan," to "There are also regions in Japan where", removed "the".
sen.e: There are also regions in Japan where the custom of eating soba noodles on New Year's Eve is less popular.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 一例として、香川県では蕎麦よりも讃岐うどんを食べる風習がある。
sen.e: For example, in Kagawa Prefecture, people prefer Sanuki Udon (udon noodles from Kagawa Prefecture, former Sanuki Province) than soba noodles, to be eaten on that occasion.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: For example, in Kagawa Prefecture, people customarily eat Sanuki Udon (udon noodles from Kagawa Prefecture, formerly Sanuki Province) instead of soba noodles.
sen.cmt: Inserted "customarily" and "to eat", removed "prefer to", changed "former" to "formerly", changed "than soba noodles, to be eaten on that occasion" to "instead of soba noodles".
sen.e: For example, in Kagawa Prefecture, people customarily eat Sanuki Udon (udon noodles from Kagawa Prefecture, formerly Sanuki Province) instead of soba noodles.
sen.cmt: 修正なし

sen.j: 全国ニュースでも東京の蕎麦屋の風景と香川のうどん屋の風景を併せて紹介するなど認知度が高くなっている。
sen.e: Sanuki Udon noodles have become well-known, thanks to NHK who aired in its nationwide news program the scenes of a Sanuki Udon shop in Kagawa Prefecture in comparison with a soba noodle shop in Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: Sanuki Udon noodles have become so well-known that even a nationwide news program showed scenes from a Sanuki Udon shop in Kagawa Prefecture together with scenes from a soba noodle shop in Tokyo.
